mods.note: MBM Please refer to your derai F.A.K official letter No.Ext. 6477/46 dated the 12th February 1947. 2. I return herewith copy No.9 of Iran Intelligence Report No.C.B.1886(X) (5/46)â€¢ 3. Will you please acknowledge its receipt. Harrison, Esq., India Office, London.w.c 3497. Miss Platt^ External ^eKistry. C.B. 1885(X)(5/46) Persia Intelligence Report. Two copies No. 8 & 9 of the above document were received by you (Your ref. Ext.6477/46). Copy No. 8 was given to War Staff and I understand Copy No. 9 was sent to P.R. P.G. As these copies should have come to the War Staff for despatch to India would you be able to retrieve Copy No. 9 from the P.R. for us to send to India?. Thank you 6 Feb.1947.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 483/47 'Sending of Iran Intelligence Reports to Persian Gulf'

physicalDescription.extent: The file's contents are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of letters between the Secretary to the Political Resident in Persian Gulf, Bahrain, and the India Office, London. The letters are regarding Iran Intelligence Report no. CB 1885(X), which was sent to the Persian Gulf Residency. The letters specify which copies were sent to Persian Gulf and War Staff. Some of the letters are notifications confirming receipt of the Report.
